s.text: One dentist I spoke with called Total "the first revolutionary toothpaste in a long time."
One dentist I spoke with called Total "the first revolutionary toothpaste in a long time."
Triclosan clings to your teeth even after you finish brushing and continues to kill bacteria (the dentist says you may feel a "residual slipperiness" after you brush with Total).
But while it's true that any fluoride toothpaste will do a fine job, certain clinical distinctions may help you choose your weapon.

For this reason, you may wish to buy CVS brand tartar control toothpaste (or a similar generic brand), which is fluoridated, has tartar control, and is every bit as effective as every other toothpaste save Colgate Total, yet costs significantly less than its flashier competitors.
Tartar control toothpastes (Crest Tartar Control, Colgate Tartar Control With Micro-Cleaning Crystals) feature an ingredient called tetrasodium pyrophosphate.
Couple this with the pump technology and the combination of gel and paste, and we have a hands down winner.
Color: Most brands opt for classic titanium white or translucent blue-green.
